text: Devon Cade has been taken by stretcher from the Philadelphia Board of Elections to a hospital.

text:
Devon Cade has collapsed at the Philadelphia Board of Elections just before hearings for challenges he filed against 30 Democratic competitors for City Council at-large.

text:
Clout:
* A Council at-large candidate who challenged 30 competitors demands a $1 million bond to inspect how he determined petitions signatures were fake
* @VoteDomb is back on TV. Will he trigger the “millionaire’s provision?
* Nick Miccarelli’s new job
author: ByChrisBrennan

text: Describe your day with five seconds of video. I’ll go first... – bei Philadelphia Media Network, LLC

text:

text: The #CanOfDestiny has arrived in City Hall, courtroom 676. @MrHornNHardart starts determining May 21 ballot position at 11 a.m. – bei City Hall Tower
author: ByChrisBrennan

text: Council President Darrell Clarke among 44 Democrats facing legal challenges to get on primary ballot https://www.philly.com/news/primary-petition-challenges-philly-darrell-clarke-ballot-20190319.html?__vfz=medium%3Dsharebar … via @phillydotcom

text: The Can of Destiny is of indeterminate age, which is to say, nobody at the Board of Elections knows for sure.

text: This could be an interesting test of just how hardened partisanship has become. If you are a Republican with Irish ancestry do you laugh this off as a political burn or do wonder what you’re party is thinking?

A question the bartender at @RoyalTavern just fielded: 
How far are we from the Rocky statue? – bei Royal Tavern
author: ByChrisBrennan

text:
UPDATE: @daylinleach responds, refusing to resign “under any circumstances.”
He adds:
“Nobody is at their best when they feel attacked. And I am truly sorry for the occasions when I reacted angrily. And while this is not an excuse, my anger was the result of deep personal hurt.”
author: ByChrisBrennan

text:
“Without exaggeration, party members have described your lashing out, lack of judgment and tone deafness, as examples of behavior not becoming a state senator and leader of our party.”
https://www.philly.com/news/montgomery-county-democrats-call-daylin-leach-to-resign-20190316.html?__vfz=medium%3Dsharebar … via @phillydotcom
